metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11462 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) allows attackers to have unspecified impact via vectors involving automatic deletion of security contexts on error. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled deletion of security contexts. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.15.2-1
krb5-gss-samples - 1.15.2-1
krb5-k5tls - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kdc - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.15.2-1
krb5-kpropd - 1.15.2-1
krb5-locales - 1.15.2-1
krb5-multidev - 1.15.2-1
krb5-otp - 1.15.2-1
krb5-pkinit - 1.15.2-1
krb5-user - 1.15.2-1
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.15.2-1
libgssrpc4 - 1.15.2-1
libk5crypto3 - 1.15.2-1
libkadm5clnt-mit11 - 1.15.2-1
libkadm5srv-mit11 - 1.15.2-1
libkdb5-9 - 1.15.2-1
libkrad0 - 1.15.2-1
libkrb5-3 - 1.15.2-1
libkrb5support0 - 1.15.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15.2-1').
